Business Information: At Roderick Walls & Associates, LLC our attorneys and staff understand and appreciate that with each client comes a unique set of circumstances and needs. Dave Smith Insurance has provided a wide variety of insurance products across the state of Alabama since 1979. Since then we have helped to provide our customers with friendly insurance services that they deserve, at quality prices.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.
Home owners insurance, Auto insurance, Business insurance, Life insurance, Motorcycle insurance, Boat insurance, Workers compensation & Bonds.

Protective Life Insurance Company is an operating subsidiary of Protective Life Corporation. The company provides insurance and investment products to individuals and families throughout the United States. It is affiliated with West Coast Life Insurance Company, Empire General Life Assurance Corporation and Protective Life and Annuity Insurance Company. Protective Life s acquisitions division acquires blocks of policies from other businesses. The company features retirement plans and investment products, such as annuities, funding agreements and guaranteed investment contracts. It also supplies asset-protection instruments, including credit insurance and service contracts. John D. Johns has been the chief executive officer of Protective Life for more than four years. He has been with the insurance company for over 13 years. Johns earned a BA from the University of Alabama, and a MBA from Harvard. Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.
Home owners insurance, Auto insurance, Business insurance, Life insurance, Motorcycle insurance, Boat insurance, Workers compensation & Bonds.

Protective Life Insurance Company is an operating subsidiary of Protective Life Corporation. The company provides insurance and investment products to individuals and families throughout the United States. It is affiliated with West Coast Life Insurance Company, Empire General Life Assurance Corporation and Protective Life and Annuity Insurance Company. Protective Life s acquisitions division acquires blocks of policies from other businesses. The company features retirement plans and investment products, such as annuities, funding agreements and guaranteed investment contracts. It also supplies asset-protection instruments, including credit insurance and service contracts. John D. Johns has been the chief executive officer of Protective Life for more than four years. He has been with the insurance company for over 13 years. Johns earned a BA from the University of Alabama, and a MBA from Harvard. Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

Since 2001, Disability Advisors has helped numerous people with disabilities receive their entitled Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - with a better than 90% award rate.  With Disability Advisors on your side, you don't have to struggle with confusing forms, short appeal deadlines, and months of not knowing the status of your claims. Disability Advisors can help you through the largest backlog of SSDI/SSI claims in the Social Security Administration's history.  Choosing Disability Advisors can significantly increase your success and typically reduce the time it takes to get your award. Disability Advisors goal is to help make the process for people with disabilities less confusing and less intimidating while keeping them better informed.  Give us a call today to setup a no-cost evaluation with one of our experts.

Recently one of our founders, Dave Paulsen, shopped for Medicare supplement insurance to cover costs that Medicare didn't. He became very frustrated. Dave's frustration led to the founding of SelectQuote Senior Insurance Services. Since 2001, Disability Advisors has helped numerous people with disabilities receive their entitled Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - with a better than 90% award rate.  With Disability Advisors on your side, you don't have to struggle with confusing forms, short appeal deadlines, and months of not knowing the status of your claims. Recently one of our founders, Dave Paulsen, shopped for Medicare supplement insurance to cover costs that Medicare didn't. He became very frustrated. Dave's frustration led to the founding of SelectQuote Senior Insurance Services. In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

Protective Life Insurance Company is an operating subsidiary of Protective Life Corporation. Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

Since 2001, Disability Advisors has helped numerous people with disabilities receive their entitled Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - with a better than 90% award rate.  With Disability Advisors on your side, you don't have to struggle with confusing forms, short appeal deadlines, and months of not knowing the status of your claims. Disability Advisors can help you through the largest backlog of SSDI/SSI claims in the Social Security Administration's history.  Choosing Disability Advisors can significantly increase your success and typically reduce the time it takes to get your award. Disability Advisors goal is to help make the process for people with disabilities less confusing and less intimidating while keeping them better informed. Recently one of our founders, Dave Paulsen, shopped for Medicare supplement insurance to cover costs that Medicare didn't. He became very frustrated. Dave's frustration led to the founding of SelectQuote Senior Insurance Services. In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

Protective Life Insurance Company is an operating subsidiary of Protective Life Corporation. The company provides insurance and investment products to individuals and families throughout the United States. Protective Life s acquisitions division acquires blocks of policies from other businesses. The company features retirement plans and investment products, such as annuities, funding agreements and guaranteed investment contracts. It also supplies asset-protection instruments, including credit insurance and service contracts. John D. Johns has been the chief executive officer of Protective Life for more than four years. He has been with the insurance company for over 13 years. Johns earned a BA from the University of Alabama, and a MBA from Harvard. Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

Since 2001, Disability Advisors has helped numerous people with disabilities receive their entitled Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - with a better than 90% award rate.  With Disability Advisors on your side, you don't have to struggle with confusing forms, short appeal deadlines, and months of not knowing the status of your claims. Disability Advisors can help you through the largest backlog of SSDI/SSI claims in the Social Security Administration's history.  Choosing Disability Advisors can significantly increase your success and typically reduce the time it takes to get your award. Disability Advisors goal is to help make the process for people with disabilities less confusing and less intimidating while keeping them better informed. Recently one of our founders, Dave Paulsen, shopped for Medicare supplement insurance to cover costs that Medicare didn't. He became very frustrated. In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

Since 2001, Disability Advisors has helped numerous people with disabilities receive their entitled Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - with a better than 90% award rate. In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

In 1989, CGH Insurance Group formed American Mining Insurance Company and a niche company specializing in mining operations was born. A group of visionary insurance professionals began building a financially viable, stable insurance carrier offering primarily workers' compensation insurance, but also providing general liability, automobile and excess liability coverage. As it has grown and expanded geographically, the company has become the preferred provider of insurance coverage to many within the mining and aggregates industries. In 2007, CGH Insurance Group and its subsidiaries, including American Mining Insurance Company, were acquired by W. R. Berkley Corporation. American Mining distributes its insurance products through a network of local independent insurance agents in Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah and Virginia. Coverage underwritten by it includes workers  compensation, general liability, pollution, business automobile, commercial umbrella and a coal truckers' program. American Mining Insurance Company maintains a location in Homewood, Ala.

The Sheffield Group, founded in 1993 and located in Birmingham, Ala., is one of the leading workers  compensation providers in the Southeast. The group has several offices in Alabama and Tennessee, and also serves clients having small minimum accounts and large accounts. It has various departments, including underwriting, billing and loss-control departments. The Sheffield Group also has audit, claims and customer service departments. The group also has a monthly reporting payment plan, and a seamless renewal process in which agents do not handle renewals. Its loss-control department mainly focuses on providing safer workplace to clients  employees. The loss-control department offers various customized safety programs for the clients.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

McGriff, Seibels & Williams is an insurance brokerage that offers a variety of programs designed to protect clients  financial interests. The company provides property and casualty insurance, employee benefits, life and pension plans, financial services and surety products. Its areas of expertise include energy and marine, financial services, commercial, construction risk, surety, health care and public entities. McGriff, Seibels & Williams was founded in 1886 and is based in Birmingham, Ala. The company maintains additional offices in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, St. Louis and Irvine, Calif. It is a part of BB&T.

Protective Life Insurance Company is an operating subsidiary of Protective Life Corporation. The company provides insurance and investment products to individuals and families throughout the United States. It is affiliated with West Coast Life Insurance Company, Empire General Life Assurance Corporation and Protective Life and Annuity Insurance Company. Protective Life s acquisitions division acquires blocks of policies from other businesses. The company features retirement plans and investment products, such as annuities, funding agreements and guaranteed investment contracts. It also supplies asset-protection instruments, including credit insurance and service contracts. John D. Johns has been the chief executive officer of Protective Life for more than four years. He has been with the insurance company for over 13 years. Johns earned a BA from the University of Alabama, and a MBA from Harvard. Protective Life Insurance Company was founded in 1907 and is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

Since 2001, Disability Advisors has helped numerous people with disabilities receive their entitled Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - with a better than 90% award rate.  With Disability Advisors on your side, you don't have to struggle with confusing forms, short appeal deadlines, and months of not knowing the status of your claims. Disability Advisors can help you through the largest backlog of SSDI/SSI claims in the Social Security Administration's history.  Choosing Disability Advisors can significantly increase your success and typically reduce the time it takes to get your award. Disability Advisors goal is to help make the process for people with disabilities less confusing and less intimidating while keeping them better informed. Recently one of our founders, Dave Paulsen, shopped for Medicare supplement insurance to cover costs that Medicare didn't. He became very frustrated. Dave's frustration led to the founding of SelectQuote Senior Insurance Services.
